Description: Jackson DK2M White Bengal Limited Run from 2007 MADE IN JAPAN. This guitar is in very very good condition but not absolutely mint. It has the EMG 81/85 pickups with the EMG solderless kit (the pickup selector is standard wiring). The frets are like new. They are polished and beautiful. The hardware shows very minimal wear. The neck is straight and shows barely any wear. The guitar plays great. The protective plastic is still on the back of the tuners. The few minor blemishes that I noticed include a mark on one of the black fretboard shark fin markers (pictured), a small ding on the back near the tremolo spring cavity cover (pictured), and a tiny finish crack in the neck pocket (pictured). It has some very minor marks in the clear hear and there but they are the kind that you have to tip in the light just right to see. There are also a few very minor scratches on the back but again they are not deep and are only in the clear coat. I also noticed a very small mark of the upper edge which can be seen in the pic of the upper edge of the guitar to the right side of the pic. It is small but I'm trying to mention everything I saw. That said, what it does not have is much in the way of swirl marks. The finish is very highly polished and VERY clean. I noticed that the tremolo spring cavity cover has a corner crack in the plastic at the corner screw hole. This is very common and is merely cosmetic. Overall I would consider this guitar a 9 out of 10 but ratings are subjective so please use the pics and description to judge if it is up to your standards or not and make offers/purchase accordingly. It will ship in a Jackson Hard shell case that has typical wear, some marks etc. and one of the little feet has been re-affixed as shown in the pic. but all latches are good and case is fully functional. I do not have the keys to the case so they are not included. This guitar is one of the cleanest used guitars I've owned.
